cosmology.name: The Great Wheel
cosmology.description: The default D&D cosmology includes more than two dozen planes. The most common understanding of these planes visualizes them as a group of concentric wheels, with the material realms at the center. The Inner Planes form a wheel around the Material Plane, enveloped in the Ethereal Plane. Then the Outer Planes form another wheel around and behind (or above or below) that one, arranged according to alignment, with the Outlands linking them all.

alternateConfigurations.name: Cosmic Tree
alternateConfigurations.description: Planes situated among the roots and branches of a great cosmic tree (literally or figuratively)

alternateConfigurations.name: Vertical Cosmology
alternateConfigurations.description: Material realms suspended between two other realities: the astral realms (the Astral Plane and the Outer Planes) above and the elemental realms (the Inner Planes) below

alternateConfigurations.name: Simplified Cosmology
alternateConfigurations.description: A cosmology with fewer planes: a Material Plane; the Transitive Planes; a single undifferentiated Elemental Plane, where all four elements churn in chaos; an Overheaven, where good deities and Celestials dwell; and an Underworld, where evil deities and Fiends reside

alternateConfigurations.name: Orbital Cosmology
alternateConfigurations.description: Planes arranged in a complex system of orbits, with planes exerting greater influence on the Material Plane the closer they draw to it

planeCategories.name: Material Realms
planeCategories.description: Most D&D worlds are located on the Material Plane, which has two planar echoes: the Feywild and the Shadowfell.

planeCategories.name: Transitive Planes
planeCategories.description: The Ethereal Plane and the Astral Plane are boundless realms that provide passage between other planes of existence.

planeCategories.name: Inner Planes
planeCategories.description: The four Elemental Planes (Air, Earth, Fire, and Water), plus the Para-elemental Planes between them, are the Inner Planes.

planeCategories.name: Outer Planes
planeCategories.description: Seventeen Outer Planes correspond to the nine alignments and shades of philosophical difference between them. The planes with an element of good in their nature are called the Upper Planes, while those with an element of evil are the Lower Planes. A plane's alignment is its essence, and a creature whose alignment doesn't match the plane's alignment experiences a sense of dissonance there.

planeCategories.name: Upper Planes
planeCategories.description: The planes with an element of good in their nature are called the Upper Planes. The Upper Planes are the home of Celestials.

planeCategories.name: Lower Planes
planeCategories.description: The planes with an element of evil in their nature are called the Lower Planes. The Lower Planes are the home of Fiends.

planeCategories.name: Neutral Planes
planeCategories.description: The planes in between Upper and Lower are home to other creatures; for example, modrons are Constructs that inhabit Mechanus, and slaadi are Aberrations that thrive in Limbo.

planeCategories.name: Positive and Negative Planes
planeCategories.description: These two planes enfold the rest of the cosmology, providing the raw forces of life and death that underlie all existence in the multiverse.

planes.name: Mount Celestia
planes.philosophicalEssence: The model of justice and order, of celestial grace and endless mercy, where angels and champions of good guard against incursions of evil.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Even the most jaded of travelers are filled with awe. Creatures strive constantly to be as righteous as possible.

physicalProperties.shape: A mountain rising from a shining Silver Sea to utterly incomprehensible heights, with seven plateaus marking its seven heavenly layers

layers.name: Lunia
layers.description: In the Silver Heaven, the holy water of the Silver Sea laps at the base of the celestial mountain under a starry sky.

notableLocations.name: Silver Sea
notableLocations.description: Holy water sea lapping at the base of the celestial mountain

layers.name: Mercuria
layers.description: The Golden Heaven's tame slopes and lush valleys are bathed in golden light that evokes the hope of a new dawn.

layers.name: Venya
layers.description: In the Pearly Heaven, terraced fields and tended woodlands dot the snowy slopes.

layers.name: Solania
layers.description: In the Crystal Heaven, holy shrines glitter under a silvery sky amid luminescent fog.

layers.name: Mertion
layers.description: On the sweeping plains of the Platinum Heaven, holy soldiers muster in grand citadels for battles across the planes.

notableLocations.name: Empyrea
notableLocations.description: A city on the edge of a clear lake, renowned for the healing power of its fountains and springs. Pilgrims from across the planes seek out the healers, hospitals, and restorative magic found here.

layers.name: Jovar
layers.description: The Glittering Heaven, strewn with beautiful rubies and garnets, is home to the seven-tiered Heavenly City.

notableLocations.name: Heavenly City
notableLocations.description: A seven-tiered city in the Glittering Heaven

layers.name: Chronias
layers.description: The Illuminated Heaven is an ineffable mystery.

environmentalEffects.name: Pervasive Goodness
environmentalEffects.description: The pervasive goodness of Mount Celestia bestows blessings on creatures on the plane.
environmentalEffects.emotionalEffect: Creatures strive to be as righteous as possible; fills travelers with awe

planes.name: Bytopia
planes.philosophicalEssence: The heaven of productive work, the satisfaction of a job well done. Personal achievement alongside social interdependence.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Goodness flowing through the plane creates feelings of goodwill and happiness in creatures dwelling there.

physicalProperties.shape: Two layers whose surfaces face each other like the covers of a closed book, about a mile apart

temperature.description: Dothion is pastoral; Shurrock has harsh weather

layers.name: Dothion
layers.description: Farms nestled among well-tamed woods are hubs of pastoral activity and individual industry.

layers.name: Shurrock
layers.description: Small communities thrive around quarries and mills amid rough country and harsh weather.

adventureThemes: Impact of actions mirrored on opposite layer

planes.name: Elysium
planes.philosophicalEssence: The embodiment of goodness, a spiritual realm where evil can't abide. Home to creatures of unfettered kindness and a refuge for planar travelers seeking a safe haven.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Tranquility and contentment seep into the bones and souls of those who enter Elysium. The longer a visitor remains, the less reason they find to ever leave.

physicalProperties.shape: Bucolic landscapes glimmering with life and beauty across four layers

layers.name: Amoria
layers.description: Small towns on the banks of the River Oceanus, surrounded by lush meadows, are among the most hospitable refuges on the Outer Planes.

layers.name: Eronia
layers.description: Steep hills, craggy mountains, and white granite valleys offer a rugged home for hardy souls.

layers.name: Belierin
layers.description: Lighthouses pierce the fog and form hubs for small communities amid sprawling marshlands.

layers.name: Thalasia
layers.description: The Heroic Isles, rising from the headwaters of the River Oceanus, hold the best departed souls.

notableLocations.name: Heroic Isles
notableLocations.description: Islands rising from the headwaters of the River Oceanus that hold the best departed souls

adventureThemes: Seeking ancient spirits on the Heroic Isles
Freeing or guarding a mysterious prisoner in Belierin

planes.name: Beastlands
planes.philosophicalEssence: A plane of nature unbound, embodying nature's wildness and beauty. It speaks to the animal within all living creatures—with respect to their physical substance and fundamental needs.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Visitors feel invigorated and more vital—minds more alert, reflexes sharpened, strides quickened. Hunger pangs are acute, but food and drink taste better. Sleep is always deep and restful.

temperature.description: Krigala is eternal summer noon; Brux is eternal twilight; Karasuthra is eternal night

layers.name: Krigala
layers.description: The River Oceanus is a strong torrent flowing through this wilderness of eternal summer noon.

layers.name: Brux
layers.description: A red sun hovers forever on the horizon as mists and streams roil through the trees in eternal twilight.

layers.name: Karasuthra
layers.description: A pale moon provides the only light in this wilderness of eternal night.

hazards.name: Beast Slayer Shapeshift
hazards.description: Whenever a visitor slays a Beast native to the plane, the slayer must succeed on a DC 10 Charisma saving throw or shape-shift into the type of Beast that was slain.

savingThrowToTraverse.triggerDescription: Whenever a visitor slays a Beast native to the plane

onFailure.description: The creature shape-shifts into the type of Beast that was slain. The creature's game statistics are replaced by the Beast's stat block, but the creature retains its alignment, personality, creature type, Intelligence score, and ability to speak.
onFailure.duration: Until three successful Long Rest saves or Remove Curse spell

savingThrowToTraverse.repeatSaveTiming: At the end of each Long Rest
recoveryMethods: Three successful saves at end of Long Rest

planes.name: Arborea
planes.philosophicalEssence: A plane of extremes: stupendously craggy mountains, unbelievably deep gorges, forests of monstrously huge trees. A larger-than-life place of violent moods and deep affections, of whim backed by steel, and of passions that blaze brightly until they burn out.
planes.emotionalInfluence: The air seems charged with excitement. Rage is as common and as honored as joy. Creatures that visit and then leave sometimes experience a desperate desire to return—a yearning so intense it can interfere with day-to-day life.

temperature.description: Sudden squalls and warm flares of sunlight

physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Sudden squalls brew up out of nowhere, beating the tree-lined paths with heavy winds. The storms pass within minutes and leave behind warm flares of sunlight.

layers.name: Arvandor
layers.description: Towering trees, colorful wildflowers, abundant grain, and delicious fruit create a lush environment.

layers.name: Aquallor
layers.description: An eternal ocean fed by the River Oceanus is home to teeming sea life and mighty storms.

layers.name: Mithardir
layers.description: A desert of white sand is abandoned by whatever powers once lived there.

adventureThemes: Discovering who you are when masks fall away

planes.name: Ysgard
planes.philosophicalEssence: Glory earned through heroic deeds in battle. It's the euphoria of an athlete, the exhilaration of a summer storm, and the triumphant celebration of victory.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Euphoria, exhilaration, and triumphant celebration. Since those who die return to life, Ysgard overlooks the horrors of war and focuses entirely on the glory.

physicalProperties.shape: Continents floating above oceans of volcanic rock, below which are enormous icy caverns

temperature.description: Summers long and hot, winters cold and unforgiving

layers.name: Ysgard
layers.description: Immense rivers of floating earth grind together in eternal rumbling.

notableLocations.name: Plain of Ida
notableLocations.description: Daily festivals let warriors and athletes show off their bravery and skill

layers.name: Muspelheim
layers.description: The ground smokes and burns beneath the earthbergs of the top layer.

layers.name: Nidavellir
layers.description: Floating chunks of earth are closer together, giving the appearance of endless tunnels with rich mineral deposits.

resurrectionRule.requirement: Killed in combat while in Ysgard

planes.name: Arcadia
planes.philosophicalEssence: Everything works toward the common good and a flawless existence. Purity is eternal, and nothing intrudes on harmony. Individuality is subsumed to peaceful life in community.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Suffused with a vigorous life energy that bestows great vitality on visitors.

physicalProperties.shape: Orchards of perfectly lined trees, ruler-straight streams, orderly fields, immaculate roads, and cities laid out in geometrically pleasing shapes
physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Governed by four allied demigods called the Storm Kings: the Cloud King, the Wind Queen, the Lightning King, and the Rain Queen.

layers.name: Abellio
layers.description: Everything in these fields of plenty is dedicated to the good of all.

layers.name: Buxenus
layers.description: Military forces gather their strength, amid pleasant valleys and orchards, to reclaim the lost layer of Menausus—now part of Mechanus.

environmentalEffects.name: Vigorous Life Energy
environmentalEffects.description: Arcadia is suffused with a vigorous life energy that bestows great vitality on visitors.

notableEntities.name: Cloud King
notableEntities.title: Storm King
notableEntities.description: One of four allied demigods governing Arcadia's weather

notableEntities.name: Wind Queen
notableEntities.title: Storm King
notableEntities.description: One of four allied demigods governing Arcadia's weather

notableEntities.name: Lightning King
notableEntities.title: Storm King
notableEntities.description: One of four allied demigods governing Arcadia's weather

notableEntities.name: Rain Queen
notableEntities.title: Storm King
notableEntities.description: One of four allied demigods governing Arcadia's weather

adventureThemes: Tension between individual freedom and societal responsibility

planes.name: Nine Hells
planes.philosophicalEssence: The ultimate plane of law and evil, and the epitome of premeditated cruelty. The devils are bound to obey the laws of their superiors, but they squabble within their individual castes.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Inflames imaginations, greed, and battle fury. Every shred of evil is used, and each layer specializes to accommodate and exploit the vices and weaknesses of mortals. Insidious manipulation, deceit, and treachery.

physicalProperties.shape: A pit where the River Styx plunges down through nine tiers

temperature.description: Varies dramatically by layer: volcanic heat on Phlegethos, freezing ice on Stygia and Cania

layers.name: Avernus
layers.description: The Blood War rages across battlefields littered with corpses and the wreckage of hellish war machines.

notableLocations.name: Avernus Battlefield
notableLocations.description: Rocky wasteland with rivers of blood and clouds of biting flies. Fiery comets occasionally fall from the darkened sky.

ruler.name: Zariel
ruler.title: Archduchess of Avernus
ruler.description: Appears as an angel whose skin and wings are scorched. Her eyes burn with a furious white light.

layers.name: Dis
layers.description: Iron roads in deep canyons lead to the dreaded Iron City of Dis.

notableLocations.name: Iron City of Dis
notableLocations.description: A hideous metropolis where planar travelers conspire with devils and close deals with Fiends.

ruler.name: Dispater
ruler.title: Archduke of Dis
ruler.description: A manipulator and deceiver, devilishly handsome, bearing only small horns, a tail, and a cloven left hoof.

layers.name: Minauros
layers.description: Acid falls like rain on putrid bogs and decaying cities.

ruler.name: Mammon
ruler.title: Archduke of Minauros
ruler.description: Resembles a massive serpent with the upper torso and head of a hairless, horned humanoid. Greed is legendary.

layers.name: Phlegethos
layers.description: Obsidian fortresses bask in the heat of raging volcanoes and magma rivers.

notableLocations.name: Abriymoch
notableLocations.description: A fortress city made of obsidian and dark glass within the caldera of the largest volcano.

ruler.name: Belial and Fierna
ruler.title: Co-rulers of Phlegethos
ruler.description: Both resemble tieflings with red skin and small horns. Belial exudes civility; Fierna is said to have the wickedest heart in the Nine Hells.

layers.name: Stygia
layers.description: Levistus's prison is a frigid hellscape of jagged ice and cold fire.

ruler.name: Levistus
ruler.title: Archduke of Stygia
ruler.description: Once betrayed Asmodeus and is now encased deep in the ice of Stygia as punishment. Rules telepathically.

layers.name: Malbolge
layers.description: An ever-crumbling mountain threatens to bury visitors.

ruler.name: Glasya
ruler.title: Archduchess of Malbolge
ruler.description: Asmodeus's daughter. Her cruelty and love of wicked schemes rival those of her father.

layers.name: Maladomini
layers.description: Swarms of hungry flies plague dead cities surrounded by utter desolation.

ruler.name: Baalzebul
ruler.title: Lord of Flies, Archduke of Maladomini
ruler.description: A tall, powerful devil with compound eyes of a fly. Cursed by Asmodeus so that any deal he makes leads to calamity.

layers.name: Cania
layers.description: Ice-trapped cities provide shelter in a realm cold enough to freeze the soul.

notableLocations.name: Mephistar
notableLocations.description: Ice citadel where Mephistopheles plots to seize the throne of the Nine Hells.

ruler.name: Mephistopheles
ruler.title: Archduke of Cania
ruler.description: Asmodeus's greatest enemy and ally. A tall, striking devil with impressive horns and a cool demeanor.

layers.name: Nessus
layers.description: Mighty fortresses stand watch over the deepest pits of the Nine Hells.

notableLocations.name: Malsheem
notableLocations.description: A gigantic hollowed-out stalagmite citadel-spire rising from a vast rift of unknown depth. Home to Asmodeus and also a prison for souls.

ruler.name: Asmodeus
ruler.title: Archduke of Nessus, Supreme Ruler of the Nine Hells
ruler.description: Most often appears as a handsome, bearded man with four large horns, piercing red eyes, and flowing robes. The most cunning and well-mannered of archdevils.

notableEntities.name: Asmodeus
notableEntities.title: Archduke of Nessus, Supreme Ruler of All Devils
notableEntities.description: Wields the power of a lesser god. A supreme tyrant, a brilliant deceiver, and a master of subtlety.

notableEntities.name: Tiamat
notableEntities.title: Queen of Evil Dragons
notableEntities.description: A prisoner on Avernus, ruling her own domain but confined to the Nine Hells by Asmodeus.

specialRules.name: No Direct Lower-Layer Portals
specialRules.description: By Asmodeus's orders, no planar portals connect directly to the lower layers of the Nine Hells. The first layer, Avernus, is the arrival point for visitors.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: All visitors must arrive at Avernus first and descend through layers in order.

adventureThemes: Descent into the heart of evil

planes.name: Gehenna
planes.philosophicalEssence: The plane of suspicion and greed, with no space for mercy or compassion.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Suspicion and greed pervade. Tensions run high and no one can be trusted.

physicalProperties.shape: A volcanic mountain dominates each of the four layers, with lesser volcanic earthbergs drifting in the air

temperature.description: Hot volcanic on Khalas and Chamada; freezing with acidic ash on Mungoth; silence and darkness on Krangath

layers.name: Khalas
layers.description: Lava illuminates clouds of volcanic ash and steam from the River Styx.

notableLocations.name: Teardrop Palace
notableLocations.description: A bustling market offering forbidden and sinister goods for sale, its teardrop shape diverting the ever-present lava flow.

layers.name: Chamada
layers.description: Constant lava flows and eruptions make overland travel difficult. Iron zeppelins piloted by yugoloths drift through the constant gray ashfall.

notableLocations.name: Tower Arcane
notableLocations.description: A sinister structure adorned with blades and spikes, guarded by arcanaloths, rumored to hold yugoloths' history and contract records.

layers.name: Mungoth
layers.description: Acidic ash mingles with falling snow on this freezing layer.

layers.name: Krangath
layers.description: The Dead Furnace is a great mountain suspended in silence and darkness, home to a coterie of liches.

environmentalEffects.name: Atmosphere of Suspicion
environmentalEffects.description: The nature of Gehenna breeds suspicion and greed, with no space for mercy or compassion.
environmentalEffects.emotionalEffect: Suspicion and greed pervade; tensions run high and no one can be trusted

civilizations.name: Yugoloths
civilizations.description: Greedy and selfish Fiends that dwell here in great numbers. Gehenna is their birthplace.

adventureThemes: Shopping at the Teardrop Palace at terrifying cost

planes.name: Hades
planes.philosophicalEssence: Places without joy, hope, or passion. The destination of many souls unclaimed by gods or Fiends. Pure, undiluted evil as an inescapable force of gravity dragging all creatures down in spirit.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Leaches away color and emotion. The plane slowly kills dreams and desires, draining hope and optimism from formerly fiery spirits. Embodies despair manifested as apathy.

temperature.description: Gray land with an ashen sky

layers.name: Oinos
layers.description: A land of dead-gray ash, stunted trees, and virulent disease is stalked by roving bands of Fiends looking for a fight or recruits for the Blood War.

layers.name: Niflheim
layers.description: Gray pine trees blanket rolling hills and rocky bluffs, and thick mists coil around their trunks.

layers.name: Pluton
layers.description: Shriveled willows, olive trees, and poplars contribute to the gloom of this concentration of the deepest despair in the multiverse.

hazards.name: Plane of Gloom
hazards.description: At the end of each Long Rest taken on the plane, a visitor makes a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature gains 1 Exhaustion level that can't be removed while in Hades. At 6 Exhaustion levels, it permanently transforms into a Larva instead of dying.

savingThrowToTraverse.triggerDescription: At the end of each Long Rest taken on the plane

onFailure.description: The creature gains 1 Exhaustion level that can't be removed while the creature is in Hades.
onFailure.cumulativeDescription: Each failed save adds 1 Exhaustion level
onFailure.terminalEffect: Permanently transforms into a Larva; all Exhaustion levels are removed

adventureThemes: Why bother? Rekindling passion and purpose

planes.name: Carceri
planes.philosophicalEssence: The grim inspiration for all other prisons in existence. A plane of desolation and despair, home for traitors and backstabbers.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Hatreds run like a deep, slow-moving river. Passions, poisons, and realm-shattering betrayals. The plane's nature breeds despair and betrayal.

physicalProperties.shape: Six layers described as a long series of spherical worlds arranged like beads on a string, each sphere consisting of six nested spheres

temperature.description: Varies from bogs to fetid jungles to deserts to mountains to frigid oceans to black ice

layers.name: Orthrys
layers.description: The River Styx meanders through a layer of vast bogs and quicksand.

layers.name: Cathrys
layers.description: The stench of decay hangs over fetid jungles and scarlet plains.

layers.name: Minethys
layers.description: Stinging sand blows in unending storms, hiding the ruins of the ancient city Payratheon.

layers.name: Colothys
layers.description: Deep chasms cut between cruel mountains make foot travel nearly impossible.

layers.name: Porphatys
layers.description: Cold, acidic oceans are fed by constant black snow.

layers.name: Agathys
layers.description: Black ice streaked with red covers this frigid realm.

escapeMethods: Secret passages hidden and guarded by traps and deadly monsters
River Styx (extremely dangerous, ferries rare and expensive)
Becoming stronger than whatever force imprisoned you
blockedSpells: All spells that leave the plane except Wish
prisonRules.portalBehavior: Portals and gates that open onto the plane become one-way only
prisonRules.escapeRequirement: Prisoners can escape Carceri only by becoming stronger than whatever force imprisoned them there

planes.name: Abyss
planes.philosophicalEssence: Embodies all that is perverse, gruesome, and chaotic. Its virtually endless layers spiral downward into ever more appalling forms. Each layer reflects the entropic nature of the Abyss—decaying, crumbling, corroded.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Loathsome corruption of chaos and evil. Temptation to turn against allies in order to survive. Hostile and uncharted.

layers.name: The Plain of Infinite Portals
layers.description: On layer 1, corroded iron fortresses defend routes to lower layers. Under a glaring red sun, the rocky ground contains gaping craters that are portals to the other layers of the Abyss.

notableLocations.name: Broken Reach
notableLocations.description: A fortress ruled by a succubus named Red Shroud; the portal leading to Plague-Mort is tucked within.

layers.name: Azzagrat
layers.description: Graz'zt's corrupt, decadent city is split across layers 45, 46, and 47.

notableLocations.name: Argent Palace
notableLocations.description: Graz'zt's seat of power in the city of Zelatar

notableLocations.name: Zelatar
notableLocations.description: A city whose bustling markets and pleasure palaces draw visitors from across the multiverse

ruler.name: Graz'zt
ruler.title: Demon Lord
ruler.description: Embodies manipulation and cruelty, tempting mortals with appalling delights and decadent luxuries.

layers.name: The Demonweb
layers.description: On layer 66, Lolth's web snares all and hides portals to other planes.

ruler.name: Lolth
ruler.title: Demon Queen of Spiders
ruler.description: Schemes entangle entire civilizations. Of all demon lords, she might have the most active interest in worlds of the Material Plane.

layers.name: Gaping Maw
layers.description: Layer 88 is a malevolent wilderness surrounding Demogorgon's ocean fortress.

notableLocations.name: Abysm
notableLocations.description: Twin serpentine towers topped with enormous fanged skulls, rising from a turbid sea

ruler.name: Demogorgon
ruler.title: Prince of Demons, The Sibilant Beast
ruler.description: A two-headed monster yearning for nothing less than undoing the order of the multiverse.

layers.name: Thanatos
layers.description: On layer 113, an endless graveyard hosts Orcus and the sleepless dead.

notableLocations.name: Everlost
notableLocations.description: A vast palace of obsidian and bone in the howling wasteland called Oblivion's End

ruler.name: Orcus
ruler.title: Demon Prince of Undeath, Blood Lord
ruler.description: Worshiped by Undead and living creatures that channel undeath. A brooding and nihilistic entity.

layers.name: The Slime Pits
layers.description: Layer 222, a fetid realm of ooze and fungi, obeys the whims of Juiblex and Zuggtmoy.

ruler.name: Juiblex and Zuggtmoy
ruler.title: Demon Lord of Slimes and Oozes / Demon Queen of Fungi
ruler.description: Two equally repugnant demon lords who coexist with little conflict.

layers.name: The Death Dells
layers.description: Yeenoghu and his gnoll servants prowl layer 422—a cruel, desolate realm.

ruler.name: Yeenoghu
ruler.title: Gnoll Lord
ruler.description: Hungers for slaughter and senseless destruction. Gnolls are his instruments on the Material Plane.

layers.name: The Endless Maze
layers.description: Layer 600's endless labyrinth turns visitors into Baphomet's prey.

ruler.name: Baphomet
ruler.title: Horned King, Prince of Beasts
ruler.description: Embodies bestial bloodlust. If he had his way, civilization would crumble and all mortals would embrace their predatory instincts.

environmentalEffects.name: Abyssal Corruption
environmentalEffects.description: The Abyss's corruption affects visitors. Much of the plane seems to be in a decaying, crumbling, or corroded state.
environmentalEffects.mechanicalEffect: See Curses and Magical Contagions in chapter 3
environmentalEffects.emotionalEffect: Contamination and corruption, temptation to turn against allies

adventureThemes: Confronting evil in one's own heart
Resisting temptation to turn against allies
Desperate last stand against demon hordes

planes.name: Pandemonium
planes.philosophicalEssence: A plane of overwhelming chaos, a great mass of rock riddled with tunnels carved by howling winds. The plane of last straws.
planes.emotionalInfluence: The incessant howling brings everyone to the edge of lashing out in frustration, breaking down in despair, or dissolving into incoherence—and then pushes them over that edge.

physicalProperties.shape: Great mass of rock riddled with tunnels
physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: Cold, noisy, dark, with no natural light. Wind extinguishes nonmagical open flames.

layers.name: Pandesmos
layers.description: Howling winds, dark streams bound for the River Styx, and blowing snow pour through vast, desolate caverns.

layers.name: Cocytus
layers.description: Winds blowing through narrower tunnels create a stronger force and louder wails, making this the so-called Layer of Lamentation.

notableLocations.name: Howler's Crag
notableLocations.description: A jagged spike rumored to have a unique magical property: anything yelled from the top finds the ears of its intended recipient anywhere in the multiverse.

layers.name: Phlegethon
layers.description: Tunnel walls absorb light while water creates intricate rock formations.

layers.name: Agathion
layers.description: Sealed-off tunnels are largely inaccessible from elsewhere, making them ideal as vaults for ancient secrets.

environmentalEffects.name: Howling Winds
environmentalEffects.description: Wind quickly extinguishes nonmagical open flames such as torches and campfires. It also makes conversation possible only by yelling, and even then only to a maximum distance of 10 feet.
environmentalEffects.mechanicalEffect: Nonmagical open flames extinguished; conversation only by yelling to max 10 feet distance
environmentalEffects.emotionalEffect: Brings everyone to the edge of frustration, despair, or incoherence

effectOnConversation.reason: Howling winds drown out normal speech

adventureThemes: What happens on your worst day

planes.name: Acheron
planes.philosophicalEssence: A plane of enforced order, where rigid conformity leads to crushed spirits and broken hopes. Dedicated soldiers, forever lacking a cause.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Instills bloodlust. Bleak nihilism of unending conflict, harsh reality of authoritarian rule, and uncaring pressures of social conformity.

physicalProperties.shape: Immense iron blocks drifting through an airy void, sometimes colliding

temperature.description: Ranges from the metallic cold of iron blocks to the frozen ice of Ocanthus

layers.name: Avalas
layers.description: Spirit soldiers wage endless wars across debris-strewn battlefields.

layers.name: Thuldanin
layers.description: Pitted, hollow cubes are filled with the cast-off machinery of war.

layers.name: Tintibulus
layers.description: Jagged blocks tumble in darkness, holding frozen memories sapped by the River Styx and crystallized into fleeting images.

layers.name: Ocanthus
layers.description: Maelstroms of razor-sharp debris swirl above a mire of black ice.

environmentalEffects.name: Bloodlust
environmentalEffects.description: The nature of Acheron instills bloodlust in those who visit the plane.

planes.name: Limbo
planes.philosophicalEssence: A plane of pure chaos, a roiling soup of impermanent matter and energy. Stone melts into water that freezes into metal, then turns into diamond that burns up into smoke that becomes snow, and on and on endlessly.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Visitors find themselves caught up in a storm of intrusive thoughts and unruly emotions, forcing them to confront the transient nature of their identity.

notableEntities.name: Slaadi
notableEntities.description: Live in Limbo and swim amid the chaos, creating nothing

notableEntities.name: Githzerai
notableEntities.description: Build entire monasteries with their minds

civilizations.name: Githzerai Monasteries
civilizations.description: Githzerai build entire monasteries with their minds, creating sanctuaries of order within the chaos

specialRules.name: Mental Object Movement
specialRules.description: As a Magic action, a creature in Limbo can make an Intelligence check to mentally move an object within 30 feet that isn't being worn or carried. DC depends on object size.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: Intelligence check as Magic action; DC by size: Tiny 5, Small 10, Medium 15, Large 20, Huge+ 25. On success, move object 5 feet plus excess over DC.

interactionCheck.name: Move Object in Limbo
interactionCheck.description: Mentally move an unattended object within 30 feet

onSuccess.description: Move the object 5 feet plus a number of feet equal to how much the total exceeded the DC

specialRules.name: Mental Object Alteration
specialRules.description: As a Magic action, a creature can make an Intelligence check to alter a nonmagical object within 30 feet that isn't being worn or carried. DC by size: Tiny 10, Small 15, Medium 20, Large+ 25.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: Intelligence check as Magic action; on success, change the object into another nonliving form of the same size.

interactionCheck.name: Alter Object in Limbo
interactionCheck.description: Change a nonmagical unattended object within 30 feet into another nonliving form of the same size

onSuccess.description: The creature changes the object into another nonliving form of the same size, such as turning a boulder into a ball of fire
onSuccess.transformationConstraints: Must be nonliving form of the same size

specialRules.name: Stabilize Area
specialRules.description: As a Magic action, a creature can make a DC 20 Intelligence check to stabilize an area within a 30-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point it can see. On success, the area is prevented from being altered by the plane for 24 hours or until the creature takes this Magic action again.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: DC 20 Intelligence check as Magic action; on success, stabilize 30-foot-radius Sphere for 24 hours.

interactionCheck.name: Stabilize Area in Limbo
interactionCheck.description: Prevent a 30-foot-radius Sphere from being altered by the plane

onSuccess.description: The area is prevented from being altered by the plane for 24 hours or until the creature takes this Magic action again

domainsOrRegions.name: Spawning Stone
domainsOrRegions.description: Said to have been created by Primus, the overlord of the modrons, the Spawning Stone absorbs chaotic energy and makes it possible to shape enclaves of order in Limbo, but the chaotic energy it absorbs is responsible for the creation of slaadi.

adventureThemes: Asserting sense of self amid chaos

planes.name: Mechanus
planes.philosophicalEssence: Perfectly regimented order reigns supreme. Law is reflected in a realm of gigantic clockwork gears, interlocked and turning according to their measure. Some theories hold they are the clockwork of time throughout the cosmos.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Absolute order. Individual consciousness is subordinated to the search for perfect order, and 'I' is ultimately subsumed into 'we'.

physicalProperties.shape: Gigantic clockwork gears interlocked and turning, each cog with its own gravity pulling toward its center

temperature.description: Equal measures of light and dark, equal proportions of heat and cold

notableEntities.name: Primus
notableEntities.title: Overlord of the Modrons
notableEntities.description: A godlike being, creator of the modrons, whose realm is called Regulus.

civilizations.name: Modrons
civilizations.description: Primary inhabitants of Mechanus who maintain its intricate clockworks

domainsOrRegions.name: Regulus
domainsOrRegions.description: The realm of Primus, creator of the modrons.

adventureThemes: Setting aside personal goals for greater causes

planes.name: Outlands
planes.philosophicalEssence: The plane of neutrality, keeping all aspects of the planes in a paradoxical balance—simultaneously concordant and in opposition. A microcosm of the planes.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Balance of opposing planar influences. The closest the Outer Planes come to being like a world on the Material Plane.

physicalProperties.shape: A great disk with varied terrain—prairies, mountains, and shallow rivers—with the Spire at the center and sixteen gate-towns evenly spaced around the outside edge

domainsOrRegions.name: Excelsior
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town with portal to Mount Celestia

domainsOrRegions.name: Plague-Mort
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town with portal to the Abyss

domainsOrRegions.name: Ribcage
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town with portal to Nine Hells

crossReferences.description: Includes extensive information on the Outlands

globalPlanarConnections.name: River Oceanus
globalPlanarConnections.description: The water of the Oceanus is sweet and fragrant, as befits its headwaters in the Blessed Fields of Elysium. It flows through each of Elysium's layers, passes through the top layer of the Beastlands, streams across the top layer of Arborea, and finally drains away somewhere in Arborea's second layer.

globalPlanarConnections.name: River Styx
globalPlanarConnections.description: The River Styx bubbles with grease, foul flotsam, and the putrid remains of battles along its banks. It churns through the top layers of the Lower Planes, with tributaries snaking through lower layers.
navigableBy: Sinister ferries crewed by skilled pilots
Souls of dead creatures from the Material Plane

globalPlanarConnections.name: Infinite Staircase
globalPlanarConnections.description: An extradimensional staircase that connects the planes. An entrance usually appears as a nondescript door. Beyond lies a small landing with a stairway leading up and down. The staircase changes appearance as it climbs and descends.
navigableBy: Any creature that can walk or climb

globalPlanarConnections.name: Yggdrasil, the World Tree
globalPlanarConnections.description: A cosmic ash tree that spans the Outer Planes and links them to many worlds of the Material Plane. Its roots stretch into the Lower Planes, touching Hades, Pandemonium, and possibly others. Most of its trunk rises through Ysgard, and its branches stretch through the Upper Planes and across the Astral to the Material Plane.

bloodWar.description: Throughout history, the teeming demon hordes of the Abyss and the regimented legions of devils from the Nine Hells have battled for supremacy in the cosmos. The Blood War is a conflict that has raged for millennia, ravaging the Lower Planes.

factions.name: Demon Hordes
factions.role: Teeming chaotic forces seeking to overwhelm through sheer numbers and destruction

factions.name: Devil Legions
factions.role: Regimented lawful forces seeking supremacy through strategy and discipline

bloodWar.adventureImplications: Powerful mortal adventurers are sometimes drawn into tangled schemes by demons and devils seeking advantage. Natives of the Upper Planes stand ready to intervene whenever the Blood War spills outside the Abyss and Nine Hells.

infernalHierarchy.title: Duke/duchess
canDemoteTo: Any lesser or greater devil form

planarAdventureSituations.situation: When magic fails to revive a dead person, the only solution is to venture to the Outer Planes to find the person's spirit and either release it from some prison or convince the person to return to life.

People who venture into the woods keep accidentally wandering into the Feywild or the Shadowfell. They might never return, return with no sense of how much time has passed, or return dramatically changed.
A long-dead oracle is the only one who knows how a terrible prophecy might be averted, but the cataclysmic fulfillment of the prophecy has already begun.
A god has stopped answering prayers and won't respond to any Commune spell.
A devil has tricked an angel into meddling in the Blood War, and the angel seeks mortal aid.
An ancestor of one of the characters must be convinced to bless the character before the full power of the character's bloodline can be unleashed.
A foolhardy knight carried a holy weapon on a doomed mission into the Nine Hells, and the powers of Mount Celestia want the weapon and the knight's remains retrieved.
A titan is imprisoned on an Outer Plane. The characters might be trying to stop those who seek to release it, or they might want to release it to help defend the world from a greater threat.

To prove themselves worthy of an even greater quest, the characters are sent to slay a horrible monster, win the favor of a powerful planar being, negotiate peace between two warring planar factions, or retrieve a long-lost item on another plane.
An item of legend is being sold at auction in Sigil, the City of Brass, or some other planar metropolis.

globalPlanarDissonance.description: Celestials who visit the Lower Planes and Fiends who visit the Upper Planes experience significant discomfort if their visits last more than a few hours. After finishing a Long Rest on a plane that is alien to its nature, a Celestial or Fiend makes a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, whenever the creature makes a D20 Test, the creature must subtract 1d4 from the roll. The effect is cumulative with each failed save and ends when the creature finishes a Long Rest on a plane that isn't opposed to its nature.

savingThrow.triggerDescription: After finishing a Long Rest on a plane that is alien to the creature's nature (Celestials on Lower Planes, Fiends on Upper Planes)

onFailure.description: Whenever the creature makes a D20 Test, the creature must subtract 1d4 from the roll. The effect is cumulative with each failed save.
onFailure.cumulativeDescription: Each failed save adds an additional 1d4 subtracted from all D20 Tests. Multiple failed saves stack.
onFailure.duration: Until the creature finishes a Long Rest on a plane that isn't opposed to its nature

onSuccess.description: No additional penalty is applied. Previously accumulated penalties remain.

savingThrow.recoveryTrigger: Finish a Long Rest on a plane that isn't opposed to the creature's nature
recoveryMethods: Finish a Long Rest on a plane that isn't opposed to the creature's nature

savingThrowProbabilities.formula: P(fail | modifier m) = max(0.05, min(0.95, (DC - 1 - m) / 20))
